etymologies: late 19th century: via German from Latin docent- ‘teaching’, from docere ‘teach’

definitions: (in certain universities and colleges) a member of the teaching staff immediately below professorial rank.
shortDefinitions: (in certain US and European universities and colleges) member of teaching staff immediately below professorial rank

definitions: a person who acts as a guide, typically on a voluntary basis, in a museum, art gallery, or zoo.
shortDefinitions: person who acts as guide in museum, art gallery
